page.title: 09Health in Framlingham.
page.content: The surgery was built in 1982 to replace some very dingy depressing rooms where the surgery used to be. About 400 patients a week visit the surgery. The staff can deal with minor accidents. Winter is the busiest time of the year because there are more accidents then. From 8.30a.m. to 12 noon is the busiest time of the day but the surgery is open until 8p.m. each weekday. There are ten rooms, the waiting room, dispensary, consulting rooms and doctor's rooms. Their oldest patient is a lady of 100 years. In the future they hope another lady doctor will be appointed to the practice as Framlingham is a growing town. If there are accidents or emergencies the ambulance has to be summoned from Saxmundham,8 miles away. Patients get to Ipswich(19 miles) in about 45 mins.
